subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Read Calligraphy
msgSnippet: I have used calligraphic pens for QS and it s very pleasurable. But since I don t have the patience to perfect by letter shapes for public consumption, I am in
messageBody:
I have used calligraphic pens for QS and it's very
pleasurable. But since I don't have the patience to
perfect by letter shapes for public consumption, I am
in the process of making a calligraphic version of the
Jerome font, which I will publish here soon for my
fellow Readians.
Carry on!

--- khoalb <albert.v.nguyen@...> wrote:

> I've been toying with the idea of using the Read
> alphabet to do
> calligraphy. My motivation was seeing some Arabic
> calligraphy which
> you can check out at
> http://www.arabiccalligraphy.com . I'm not much
> of an artist, but I've tried my hand at it. I
> uploaded two files in
> the Calligraphy folder. Has anyone else done this
> or thought about
> doing this?
>
>
>
>
>
>


Bob McBroom Woodstock NY- /byb /mk/brMm /wUdstak /nV /jDk"wun simbel iz az gUd Az anuHD prOvFdid evrIwun atacez H sEm mIniN tM it." - /JPJ /bxnRd /SY

I have used calligraphic pens for QS and it's very
pleasurable. But since I don't have the patience to
perfect by letter shapes for public consumption, I am
in the process of making a calligraphic version of the
Jerome font, which I will publish here soon for my
fellow Readians.
Carry on!
